name: places/ChIJsxguiyb2wokRj-gssnko5J0
formattedAddress: 164 W 100th St, New York, NY 10025, USA
adrFormatAddress: 164 W 100th St, New York, NY 10025, USA

originalText.text: This place is nasty..not far from bowery mission shelter.

text.text: This place is nasty..not far from bowery mission shelter.

originalText.text:
if you would like the director, wendy kaplan, and staff member domidick, to consistently ignore your needs and safety concerns and get kicked out for SELF-defense against someone spitting at you and another resident, then this place is for you.
forget that the precinct is right across the street from you. if you like to commit crime, just know the precinct will treat you with more human decency than wendy. wendy had already been addressed by others about her colorism situation so i don’t need to get into that before i hear about crocodile tears. i stated on three different occasions that i didn’t feel safe or comfortable around a resident— not only was that consistently disregarded, but action was only take after the fact that i had to defend myself against biological warfare. when people have little power, agency or status in society, they may find they can weaponise their own body and just get a slap on the wrist. the other half ends up having to pay for other people’s lack of accountability. if i could give them zero stars i would. i didn’t even like to cook or shower here because of the LACK of hygiene unless i cleaned it myself. oh, and let’s not forget the bedbugs found in the place. exterminators were never called. blood and fecal matter on bathroom surfaces. all you can count on is laundry money and a bed. that’s it. and even then. it’s not worth it.
